So, isn't sleep paralysis when you wake up temporarily paralized?
From a lucid dream?
I think he problem with me almost never drawing even digitally is that I don't know what to draw.
look up guides
you should see the morrowind house i drew in paint x3
Sleep paralysis is a natural paralysis that your body induces to itself whenever you're asleep.
You just don't realize it happens most of the time because the act of waking up normally undoes it.
But the nightmares I was experiencing, and forcing myself to wake up from left me in that condition even after I was totally awake.
Normal stuff like breathing isn't affected, but you can't do anything else but that and blinking.
Like, trying to breathe on purpose, like take a deep breath, is impossible.
Its a very panic inducing situation by itself, and having it happen after a lucid nightmare is... Well, the stuff of nightmares.
woah. So you experience what you do when you're asleep, as you're awake...
I've had dreams where I knew what was happening around me while sleeping but not that.
Yeah, it happens mostly to folks with sleep conditions. My father for instance has sleep apnea and wakes up with paralysis all the time.
how does it wear off though?
Nothing you can do but wait for a minute or two.
Doesn't help that it feels like eternity in the moment though.
so it wears off through a short period of time
hmm
Like my dad, he's gone through it countless times, but he still panics when it happens.
I almost want it to happen to me just to see what it feels like. But I'm not hoping
From what mom tells me, he tries to break it by screaming, but it only comes out as a choking gurgle until it wears off and he's able to actually scream.
It's not fun man. It's really actually the worst.

acually,

and breath
